p: Consumption of herbal remedies containing extracts of one or more herbs such as Alchornea cordifolia ( A. cordifolia), Polyalthia longifolia ( P. longifolia), Moringa oleifera ( M. oleifera), and Mangifera indica ( M. indica) for the treatment of malaria is high in Ghana [ 4, 11]. In Ghana, the course of treatment for herbal antimalarial products range between 1 and 2 weeks [ 4]. Exposure of P. falciparum parasites to suboptimal drug concentrations as well as long-treatment regimens with antimalarial drugs can result in the parasites developing drug resistance [ 12, 13].
